Name: batch dyeing, fibre, cotton | batch dyeing, fibre, cotton | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/13:Manufacture of textiles/131:Spinning, weaving and finishing of textiles/1313:Finishing of textiles
Description: The following processes are used to dye cotton fibre: Preparing fibre for Dyeing (Ready for Dyeing) by adding bleaching chemicals, Dyeing, hydro extraction, drying, conditioning, and utilities. The process involves immersing fibre in dyebath and the bath circulates around the fibre. Bath is heated by electricity generated steam. This is followed by water extraction, drying and conditioning. The fibre is then folded and sent for further processing, i.e., garment production.
